item.description: Myles Standish State Forest is home to one of the Earth’s largest remaining pine barrens.  These forests consist of pitch pine and scrub oak woodlands and are characterized by sandy soils that are poor in nutrients, prone to drought, have relatively frequent forest fires, and are home to highly specialized plant and animal species. This 3 mile hike will take us through the pine barrens and to the site of a recent prescribed burn.  Bring water, wear good hiking shoes, and dress for the weather.  Meet at Parking Lot 2 on Upper College Pond Road.  Rain, snow, or icy trails will cancel.  For adults.  Call (508) 866-2580 x161 for more information about the hike.  For park information and a trail map, including parking lots, visithttp://www.mass.gov/dcr/parks/southeast/mssf.htm.

group.name: Friends of Myles Standish State Forest Meetup Group

item.name: DCR Pine Barrens hike: A forest at risk
